titleInfo.title: Journal of the Second Provisional Regiment, Tennessee State Guard, March/April 1944, Schedule of Instruction

mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
mods.abstract: Chart showing the schedule of instruction for the State Guard encampment at Camp Forrest for the week of March 25 to April 1, 1944.

Camp Forrest operated as a major World War II training camp, hospital center, and maneuvers base from 1941 to 1946. Having been constructed east of Tullahoma and near the site of the old Camp Peay National Guard Camp, it occupied 85,000 acres, aneventually became a prisoner of war camp as well.
